header_summary: Steven Roose has developed a specification for the concept of a TxHash (Transaction Hash) and its formalization, introducing new opcodes and addressing resource usage concerns. Johan Torås Halseth shares an email discussing the implementation of the MATT challenge protocol using Bitcoin Script. Antoine Riard explores the concept of OP_EVICT in off-chain payment pools and suggests exploring covenant flexibility. Tony Giorgio and Gijs van Dam discuss decorrelated payments as a potential advancement from PTLCs. Vincent Palazzo corrects a previous post and provides the correct link. ZmnSCPxj discusses the implementation of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism, explaining its purpose and providing calculations for its use.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
recent_posts.summary:
- Steven Roose has worked on a specification for a TxHash (Transaction Hash) concept.
- The specification includes a TxFieldSelector to select data within a transaction.
- Steven is seeking wider feedback and community interest in the proposal for a TxHash concept.

recent_posts.title: MATT: [demo] Optimistic execution of arbitrary programs
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the implementation of the original MATT challenge protocol.
- It includes a link to a detailed write-up on transforming a program for verification on-chain.
- The write-up also provides instructions on running the code and inspecting transactions.

recent_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
recent_posts.summary:
- Antoine Riard discusses the concept of OP_EVICT in an off-chain payment pool.
- He raises concerns about the safety of this approach and proposes alternative solutions.
- Antoine questions the best direction to address the high interactivity issue in payment pools.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs van Dam mentions a concept related to decorrelated payments in a discussion with Tony Giorgio.
- Gijs sees potential for the concept in assisting with decorrelated payments on an amount analysis level.
- Gijs refers to the concept as a step up after PTLC's and additional timing analysis protections.

recent_posts.title: Announcing the Lightning Network Interoperability Initiative
recent_posts.summary:
- Vincent acknowledges an error in his previous post and provides the correct link.
- He apologizes for any confusion caused by the mistake.
- The correct link was mentioned in a previous post.

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses the implementation of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism.
- They mention the numbers to consider: stages, steps per stage, and blocks per step.
- The purpose of the sidepool mechanism is to balance channels and avoid frequent on-chain transactions.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- The maximum annual growth rate of blockchain storage is estimated at 210.24GB.
- A 5TB hard drive can last for 21 years before running out of space.
- Ongoing optimization efforts reduce the amount of space required by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the challenge of scaling Lightning for casual users and suggests using simple covenants.
- Simple covenants can eliminate the bottleneck of obtaining signatures from casual users and enable the creation of Lightning channels.
- Timeout-trees and FFO-WF protocol can be used to rollover funds and improve the scalability of Lightning.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes implementation details, functional tests, and revised opcode specifications.
- The new opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY, enables the full generality of MATT with just two opcodes.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the challenge of scaling Lightning and proposes solutions to overcome it.
- Simple covenants and timeout-trees can greatly improve the scalability of Lightning for payments.
- The email hopes for the addition of CTV or APO to Bitcoin's consensus rules.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to document a secure architecture for lightning nodes.
- The architecture utilizes a hardware security module as a whitelisted lightning peer.
- Minimal changes to the lightning node are required, and Bastien offers to contribute and review.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg's email emphasizes the importance of PTLCs as taproot channels are about to be implemented.
- Greg provides a detailed analysis of PTLC messages, exploring various factors and their compatibility with other schemes.
- He suggests that his insights serve as a refresher and encourages discussion and feedback.
